response.content:
```json
{
  "step1": "Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 8-inch round cake pans. In a large bowl, whisk together 1 ¾ cups all-purpose flour, 2 cups granulated sugar, ¾ cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 1 ½ teaspoons baking soda, and 1 teaspoon baking powder.",
  "step2": "In another bowl, combine 1 cup buttermilk, ½ cup vegetable oil, 2 large eggs, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, and 1 cup strong hot coffee. The coffee enhances the chocolate flavor without making the cake taste like coffee.",
  "step3": "Gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, mixing on medium speed with an electric mixer until just combined. Be careful not to overmix the batter; overmixing can lead to a dry cake.",
  "step4": "Divide the batter evenly between the two prepared cake pans. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a wooden skewer inserted into the center of the cakes comes out clean. Baking times may vary.",
  "step5": "Let the cakes cool in the pans for 10 minutes before inverting them onto a wire rack to cool completely. Ensure cakes are fully cool before frosting to prevent the frosting from melting.",
  "step6": "Prepare your favorite chocolate frosting. Once cakes are cool, spread a generous layer of frosting between the two layers and then cover the top and sides of the cake. Garnish with chocolate shavings if desired."
}
```
